alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Cerro Gordo; Franklin; Hancock; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Sac; Webster; Wright (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 27 at 9:23PM CST until January 28 at 9:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Moderate to Heavy Snow and Hazardous Travel Saturday... .Moderate to heavy snowfall will develop early Saturday and persist through the day over the northern half of Iowa. Amounts will be heaviest north of Highway 30 with a quick drop off in amounts to the south. The heaviest snowfall rates will likely occur during the morning hours. The precipitation is likely to diminish later in the afternoon, and may be mixed with freezing drizzle at times central and south. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 PM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches, with locally heavier amounts possible. * WHERE...Much of north central Iowa. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 9 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered roads and slippery conditions. Areas of blowing snow could also significantly reduce visibility. Cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in prolonged exposure.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
